member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIAnomalySpawnModes
member.summary: Space anomalies can be set up in a variety of different orbits.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalySpawnModes.randomOrbit
member.summary: Spawns in a random solar or planetary orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalySpawnModes.randomSolarOrbit
member.summary: Spawns in a random solar orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalySpawnModes.randomPlanetOrbit
member.summary: Spawns in a random planetary orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalySpawnModes.everyLastPlanet
member.summary: Spawns in random orbit of every last planet in each star system. One per each planet. Ignores maxInstances.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalySpawnModes.fixedOrbit
member.summary: Spawns in a fixed orbit. One anomaly per orbit. Ignores maxInstances and orbitType.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalyOrbitTypes.elliptical
member.summary: Your garden variety elliptical orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalyOrbitTypes.flyBy
member.summary: Fly-by orbit

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnomalyOrbitTypes.random
member.summary: Randomly select either elliptical or flyBy.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture
member.summary: This class lets you animate textures by displaying a series of images in sequence. You can animate a material's diffuse and emissive texture. You include several textures that act as the individual animation frames, and the part module will show them in sequence. This is NOT as efficient as a texture strip but it's the best I can do for now, and it's easier to set up the UV maps on the meshes being animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.debugMode
member.summary: A flag to enable/disable debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.moduleID
member.summary: The ID of the part module. Since parts can have multiple animated textures, this field helps identify them.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.textureTransformName
member.summary: Name of the transform whose textures will be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.animatedEmissiveTexture
member.summary: The name of the animated texture, like "WarpPlasma." The actual textures should be numbered in sequence (WarpPlasma1, WarpPlasma2, etc).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.animatedDiffuseTexture
member.summary: The name of the diffuse texture. It too can be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.minFramesPerSecond
member.summary: The minimum animation speed.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.maxFramesPerSecond
member.summary: The maximum animation speed. Testing shows that with frame updates happening every 0.02 seconds, that corresponds to 50 frames per second.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.emissiveFadeTime
member.summary: In seconds, how fast should the emissive fade when the animation isn't activated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.isActivated
member.summary: The activation switch. When not running, the animations won't be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.animationThrottle
member.summary: A throttle control to vary the animation speed between minFramesPerSecond and maxFramesPerSecond

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.fadesAtMinThrottle
member.summary: A toggle that indicates whether or not to fade out the animations when the animationThrottle is set to zero.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.blendTextures(System.Single,UnityEngine.Texture2D,UnityEngine.Texture2D,UnityEngine.Texture2D)
member.summary: Blends two textures together and stores the result in an output texture. Curtesy of stupid_chris
member.param: Percentage to blend through (from 0 to 1)
Beginning texture
Finishing texture
Texture to appear blended

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIAnimatedTexture.getTextures(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all the textures for the specified name. If the name is "WarpPlasma" for instance, then the array of textures will have "WarpPlasma1" "WarpPlasma2" and so on. The method will keep looking for textures until it can no longer find a texture in the numbered sequence.
member.param: The base name of the texture to search for. It should have the relative path such as WildBlueIndustries/Blueshift/Parts/Engine/WarpPlasma.
member.returns: An array of string containing the numbered textures that comprise the animation.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil
member.summary:
Warp coils produce the warp capacity needed for vessels to go faster than light. Warp capacity is a fixed resource, but the resources needed to produce it are entirely optional.
` MODULE { name = WBIWarpCoil textureModuleID = WarpCoil warpCapacity = 10 RESOURCE { name = GravityWaves rate = 200 FlowMode = STAGE_PRIORITY_FLOW } } `

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.debugMode
member.summary: A flag to enable/disable debug mode.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.textureModuleID
member.summary: Warp coils can control WBIAnimatedTexture modules. This field tells the generator which WBIAnimatedTexture to control.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.runningEffect
member.summary: Warp coils can play a running effect while the generator is running.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.warpCapacity
member.summary: The amount of warp capacity that the coil can produce.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.isActivated
member.summary: The activation switch. When not running, the animations won't be animated.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.animationThrottle
member.summary: A control to vary the animation speed between minFramesPerSecond and maxFramesPerSecond

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.displacementImpulse
member.summary: Warp coils can efficiently move a certain amount of mass to light speed and beyond without penalties. Going over this limit incurs performance penalties, but staying under this value provides benefits. The displacement value is rated in metric tons.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpCoil.waterfallFXModule
member.summary: Optional (but highly recommended) Waterfall effects module

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBICircularizationStates

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICircularizationStates.doNotCircularize

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICircularizationStates.needsCircularization
member.summary: Orbit needs to be circularized.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICircularizationStates.hasBeenCircularized
member.summary: Orbit has been circularized

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBICircularizationStates.canBeCircularized
member.summary: Orbit can be circularized.

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine
F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.moduleDescription
member.summary: Short description of the module as displayed in the editor.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.minPlanetaryRadius
member.summary: Minimum planetary radius needed to go to warp. This is used to calculate the user-friendly minimum warp altitude display.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.minWarpAltitudeDisplay
member.summary: Minimum altitude at which the engine can go to warp. The engine will flame-out unless this altitude requirement is met.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpSpeed
member.summary: The FTL velocity of the ship, measured in C, that is adjusted for throttle setting and thrust limiter.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.spatialLocation
member.summary: Where we are in space.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.vesselCourse
member.summary: The vessel's course- which is really just the selected target.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.targetDistance
member.summary: Distance to the vessel's target

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.planetarySOISpeedCurve
member.summary: Limits top speed while in a planetary or munar SOI so we don't zoom past the celestial body. Out in interplanetary space we don't have a speed limit. The first number represents how close to the SOI edge the vessel is (1 = right at the edge, 0.1 = 10% of the distance to the SOI edge) The second number is the top speed multiplier.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.displacementImpulse
member.summary: Warp engines can efficiently move a certain amount of mass to light speed and beyond without penalties. Going over this limit incurs performance penalties, but staying under this value provides benefits. The displacement value is rated in metric tons.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpCurve
member.summary: In addition to any specified PROPELLANT resources, warp engines require warpCapacity. Only parts with a WBIWarpCoil part module can generate warpCapacity. The warp curve controls how much warpCapacity is neeeded to go light speed or faster. The first number represents the available warpCapacity, while the second number gives multiples of C. You can apply any kind of warp curve you want, but the baseline uses the Fibonacci sequence * 10. It may seem steep, but in KSP's small scale, 1C is plenty fast. This curve is modified by the engine's displacementImpulse and current vessel mass. effectiveWarpCapacity = warpCapacity * (displacementImpulse / vessel mass)

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.waterfallEffectController
member.summary: Name of the Waterfall effects controller that controls the warp effects (if any).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.waterfallWarpEffectsCurve
member.summary: Waterfall Warp Effects Curve. This is used to control the Waterfall warp field effects based on the vessel's current warp speed. The first number represents multiples of C, and the second number represents the level at which to drive the warp effects. The effects value ranges from 0 to 1, while there's no upper limit to multiples of C, so keep that in mind. The default curve is: key = 0 0 key = 1 0.5 key = 1.5 1

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.textureModuleID
member.summary: The name of the WBIAnimatedTexture to drive as part of the warp effects.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.photonicBoomEffectName
member.summary: Optional effect to play when the vessel exceeds the speed of light.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.isInSpace
member.summary: (Debug visible) Flag to indicate that we're in space (orbiting, suborbital, or escaping)

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.meetsWarpAltitude
member.summary: (Debug visible) Flag to indicate that the ship meets minimum warp altitude.

member.summary: (Debug visible) Flag to indicate that the ship has sufficient warp capacity.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.bowShockTransformName
member.summary: Name of optional bow shock transform.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.applyWarpTranslation
member.summary: (Debug visible) Flag to indicate that the engine should apply translation effects. Multiple engines can work together as long as each one's minimum requirements are met.

member.summary: (Debug visible) Total displacement impulse calculated from all active warp engines.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.warpFlameout
member.summary: Due to the way engines work on FixedUpdate, the engine can determine that it is NOT flamed out if it meets its propellant requirements. Therefore, we keep track of our own flameout conditions.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.waterfallFXModule
member.summary: Optional (but highly recommended) Waterfall effects module

member.summary: Flag to indicate whether or not the vessel has exceeded light speed.

member.summary: Determines whether or not the engine is ignited and operational.
member.returns: true if the engine is activated, false if not.

member.summary: Checks flamout conditions including ensuring that the ship is in space, meets minimum warp altitude, and has sufficient warp capacity.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.HasWarpCapacity

member.returns: true if the ship has sufficient warp capacity, false if not.

member.summary: Determines whether or the ship is in space. To be in space the ship must be sub-orbital, orbiting, or escaping.
member.returns: true if the ship is in space, false if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.MeetsWarpAltitude
member.summary: Determines whether or not the ship meets the minimum required altitude to go to warp.
member.returns: true if the ship meets minimum altitude, false if not.

member.summary: Calulates the total warp capacity from the vessel's active warp coils. Each warp coil must successfully consume its required resources in order to be considered.

member.returns: true if the coil successfully consumed its required resources, false if not.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBIWarpEngine.shouldApplyWarp
member.summary: Looks for all the active warp engines in the vessel. From the list, only the top-most engine in the list of active engines should apply warp translation. All others simply provide support.

member.name: T:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario
member.summary: This class helps starships determine when they're in interstellar space.

member.summary: Shared instance of the helper.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.interstellarWarpSpeedMultiplier
member.summary: When in intersteller space, vessels can go much faster. This multiplier tells us how much faster we can go. For comparison, Mass Effect Andromeda's Tempest can cruise at 4745 times light speed, or 13 light-years per day.

member.summary: It can cost resources to auto-circularize a ship after warp.

member.name: F:Blueshift.BlueshiftScenario.circularizationCostPerTonne

member.name: T:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly
member.summary: Describes a space anomaly. Similar to asteroids, space anomalies are listed as unknown objects until tracked and visited. Each type of anomaly is defined by a SPACE_ANOMALY config node.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.name
member.summary: Identifier for the space anomaly.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.partName
member.summary: Name of the part to spawn

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.sizeClass
member.summary: Like asteroids, space anomalies have a size class that ranges from Size A (12 meters) to Size I (100+ meters). The default is A.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.spawnMode
member.summary: How does an instance spawn

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.orbitType
member.summary: The type of orbit to create. Default is elliptical.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.maxDaysToClosestApproach
member.summary: For flyBy orbits, the max number of days until the anomaly reaches the closest point in its orbit. Default is 30.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.flyByOrbitChance
member.summary: For orbitType = random, on a roll of 1 to 100, what is the chance that the orbit will be flyBy. Default is 50.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedBody
member.summary: For fixedOrbit, the celestial body to spawn around.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedSMA
member.summary: For fixedOrbit, the Semi-Major axis of the orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedEccentricity
member.summary: For fixedOrbit, the eccentrcity of the orbit.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.fixedInclination
member.summary: Fixed inclination. Only used for fixedOrbit. If set to -1 then a random inclination will be used instead.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.minLifetime
member.summary: For undiscovered objects, the minimum number of seconds that the anomaly can exist. Default is 86400 (1 day). Set to -1 to use maximum possible value. When set to -1, maxLifetime is ignored.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.maxLifetime
member.summary: For undiscovered objects, the maximum number of seconds that the anomaly can exist. Default is 1728000 (20 days).

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.spawnTargetNumber
member.summary: Spawn chance in a roll between 1 and 1000

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.maxInstances
member.summary: Maximum number of objects of this type that may exist at any given time. Default is 10. Set to -1 for unlimited number.

member.name: F:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.vesselId
member.summary: ID of the vessel as found in the FlightGlobals.VesselsUnloaded.

member.name: M:Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly.CreateNewInstancesIfNeeded(System.Collections.Generic.List{Blueshift.WBISpaceAnomaly})
member.summary: Checks to see if we should create a new instance.
